questions.question: What is the meaning of the "francs" as it is used in the story?

choices.answer: cookies
teeth
coins
dogs

questions.question: Name two things Marcel was not allowed to do?

choices.answer: run and jump
chew a bone and bark
beg and roll over
bark and jump on the furniture

questions.question: The author describes Bibot as a "fussy" man.  What does fussy mean?

choices.answer: busy and rich
clean and kind
finicky and ill tempered
happy and smart

questions.question: What shows that Bibot was a mean person?

choices.answer: Bibot was sure to teach him a lesson.
"This tooth must come out," he said with a smile.
The poor animal wasn't even allowed to bark.
All of the above.

questions.question: How did the woman pay for her tooth extraction?

choices.answer: 3 francs
Offered to take care of Marcel
two figs
pills to kill the pain

questions.question: What did the old woman mean by her "wink?"

choices.answer: The figs were rotten.
He could sell the figs for money.
She thought Bibot was cute.
The figs were "special" because they made dreams come true.

questions.question: What was Bibot's reaction to being given figs for his services?

choices.answer: He said "Thank you."
He said she could keep them.
He refused to give her pills for her pain.
He told her that he was allergic to figs.

questions.question: How did Bibot discover that the figs were indeed magical?

choices.answer: His dream came true.
Marcel's dream came true
He believed the old woman right away.
The fig spoke to him.

questions.question: Bilbot decides not to waste the second fig.  What does that mean?

choices.answer: He'll make sure he has the "best" dream to come true.
He'll eat the fig before it rots.
He'll give the fig back to the old woman.
He'll share the fig.
So he can control Marcel.
So he can read minds.
So he can use it on his patients.
So he dreams the best dream to become rich and famous.

questions.question: What is Bibot's plan for Marcel once he is rich and famous?

choices.answer: Marcel will live with him.
Marcel will have a new dog house.
Marcel will not be coming with him.
Bibot will find Marcel the perfect place in his new home.

questions.question: What is Bibot's reaction to Marcel eating the fig?

choices.answer: Bibot was angry and chased him around the apartment.
Bibot said that it was okay.
Bibot called 911.
Bibot took Marcel for a walk.

questions.question: Where was Bibot when he woke up the next morning?

choices.answer: Bibot was in his bed safe and warm.
Bibot was at his dentist office.
Bibot was under his bed.
Bibot was sleeping on the couch.

questions.question: What was Marcel's dream after eating the fig?

choices.answer: He dreamt he was rich and famous.
He dreamt he was at the dog pound.
He dreamt he ate all the figs in the world.
He dreamt that he switched bodies with Bibot.

questions.question: What happened at the end of the story?

choices.answer: Bibot and Marcel switched bodies.
Bibot became rich and famous.
Marcel ran away.
Marcel was still hiding under the bed.
